A '''turtle shell''' is a variant of [[helmet]] that is crafted from [[turtle scute]]s. It is the third-highest [[tier]] of helmet, having the same armor points as [[Golden Helmet|golden]], [[Copper Helmet|copper]], [[Iron Helmet|iron]], and [[chainmail helmet]]s but with higher durability. When equipped, it grants ten seconds of [[Water Breathing]] to a [[player]] who [[Drowning|runs out of air]]. It is also a [[brewing]] ingredient for [[potions of the Turtle Master]].

== Usage ==
=== Turtle shell effect ===
While equipped by a [[player]], the turtle shell provides the [[Water Breathing]] status effect, allowing the wearer to remain underwater for an additional 10 seconds. The effect immediately recharges after exposure to air. The Water Breathing effect does not activate for other [[mob]]s.

==== Unit repair ====
{{main|Anvil mechanics#Unit repair}}
{{Repairing
|head=1
|Damaged Turtle Shell
|Damaged Turtle Shell; Turtle Scute
|Turtle Shell
|tail=1
}}

A turtle shell can be repaired in an [[anvil]] by adding [[turtle scute]]s, with each scute restoring 25% the turtle shell's maximum durability, rounded down. Two turtle shells can also be combined in an anvil. Both methods preserve the helmet's [[Enchanting|enchantment]]s.

=== Armor trimming ===
It is possible to upgrade turtle shells with trims. This requires a [[smithing template]], a turtle shell, and an ingot or crystal ([[iron ingot]], [[copper ingot]], [[gold ingot]], [[netherite ingot]], [[emerald]], [[redstone dust]], [[lapis lazuli]], [[amethyst shard]], [[nether quartz]], [[diamond]], or [[resin brick]]).

These trims have no effect on the gameplay or strength of the armor.

== Trivia ==
* The turtle shell is the only helmet that is not a part of a complete set.
* Defense point values exist in the code for all other pieces of a theoretical "turtle" armor set. These are: {{armor|6}} for [[chestplate]]s, {{armor|5}} for [[leggings]], and {{armor|2}} for [[boots]], which is identical to a full set of iron.
